website_summaries.verdict: Highly durable and corrosion resistant materials that give you a good performance for a low price.
pros: Small universal lug wrench that will fit easier in vehicle storage compartments than some other options
Includes four different socket heads ranging from eleven-sixteenths to seven-eighths of an inch (roughly 17 to 22 millimeters)
Will fit most lug nuts properly
Uses a chrome-plated material to resist rust
Extremely low price for this invaluable tool
cons: On the small side, so you won't receive a high level of torque
Won't fit some nuts tightly enough

customer_reviews.title: Very brittle material. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible quality it deserves zero stars. I bought this wrench for when i find myself in an emergency and was i lucky to have a back up wrench. The so called heavy duty wrench broke on the first lug. Unfortunately my return window is over and i can't get my money back. Don't waste your money on this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Omar S.

customer_reviews.title: Will not work for tight lugs.
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable for the price BUT there is a major shortcoming (for all tools shaped like this). Given the short length of the arms - it is hard to get enough torque to loosen wheel lugs especially if they were tightened by a pro shop using impact wrenches. I would strongly recommend testing out the tool before packing it away for use when you get a flat tire. Machining is ok - I was able to grip on the lugs but it is not very precise and the alloy is medium soft so I suspect will strip over time. Not a pro tool by any measure.
customer_reviews.author: VW

customer_reviews.title: Bleh...
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a cheap 4-way lug wrench - here you are. If you want a tool that will make it easier to spin off nuts with ease - this is not for you. Spend the most you can afford on the tool you need. This wrench is great to throw under your seat in the truck and forget about it until you need it. It is small enough to not be cumbersome, yet not big enough that it will still make you work to get the bolt off. I'd probably pass on this one if I had it to do over again.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Not as Pictured-Has center riveted flange
customer_reviews.text: Not as pictured. Made a crack noise when undoing third wheel nut. Has riveted center square, sharp and cut my finger on center flanges. Returning darn thing.
customer_reviews.author: Zapper

customer_reviews.title: Take a look at a ruler before you buy...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I was thinking, but 14" is ridiculously small...tiny even. It looks like a toy! You couldn't possibly get any leverage to remove a stubborn lug nut with this thing. We're returning it and getting one in a store where we can see it. I'm giving 3 stars because it is what it says it is - a teeny-tiny lug wrench. Not the companies fault I didn't pay attention to the size.
customer_reviews.author: Alice L. Shockley

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, not heavy-duty
customer_reviews.text: Great price, quick delivery however; very flimsy for a self proclaimed "Heavy duty " item. Definitely a mistake on my end, the main challenge is to create the needed momentum with a 14" cross, basically you get 7" of momentum per side, not enough. Was very difficult to work with. I might be wrong but I can't imagine this contact point between the two pieces (center of the cross) will stay welded for long, especially if you are planning to use a longer bar for momentum.
customer_reviews.author: TF

customer_reviews.title: Small for 3/4 ton pickup
customer_reviews.text: Probably OK for light duty, My fault for not paying attention to size when ordering. Having said that, the length of the bars do not offer enough leverage for large pickup or trailers. Especially if the rims and tires were installed at a tire shop. Tire shops over torque the lug nuts. That means manual removal is problematic. 14" is not up to the task.
customer_reviews.author: S. Steves

customer_reviews.title: Heavyweight lug wrench
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid lug wrench. Middle weld is perfectly formed and makes this wrench a non worry when it is needed. Heavyweight construction is solid with 4 lugs and the stamped sizes for each of the arms. This has the heft and feel of a very expensive wrench. At 14" it seems perfect for leverage on wheel lugs and is easily stored. I don't review every purchase on Amazon. So, when I give something 5 stars, it works.
customer_reviews.author: JMeady

customer_reviews.title: It's a lug wrench
customer_reviews.text: I personally like cross lug wrenches. This one has four different nut sizes on it and works fine. The only downside is I don't like the look of the weld. It hasn't broken while I've used it (and I usually use foot pressure to unlock the old lug nuts) so that's good, the weld just looks weak.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great for a spare or back up
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our RV to have on hand as a back up. The 14" is a bit small for leverage, but not bad, you might have to put a bit more effort into breaking lugs loose, but still a great price for a spare tire iron. Some of the cheaper ones at big box stores are still $15 or more.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Inness

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: not a traditional long bar tire tool. the lug bars are rather short. made for a difficult tire removal because you can not get good leverage to turn lugs off if they are to tight. seems everything you order from these sites always has had the quality cut in some way. even a standard lug tool hasnt escaped the cheapening of products sold in the United States.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Ray

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: I actually haven't had to use these yet, but they appear to be sturdy and durable. I realized that I had three vehicles and one small lug wrench so I figured I would make sure all of the cars had a proper lug wrench in case of a tire emergency and these were a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Wegman

customer_reviews.title: Quickly remove wheel nuts and bolts!
customer_reviews.text: Like this tool because it is well made and nicely chrome plated. I keep it in my road emergency collection to use when changing a wheel/tire combination. After loosening the nut/bolt with a breaker bar, I use this tool to spin-off the nut/bolt, saving considerable time.
customer_reviews.author: wideangle

customer_reviews.title: Lacks leverage
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy lug wrench but, be warned - the size is it's weakness. 14" is too small to gain needed leverage for breaking loose your lug nuts above, I would estimate 80 ft. lbs. Just imagine, as I didn't do before ordering, 14" is slightly more than a foot - and that is a dinky lug wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great little lug wrench
customer_reviews.text: This heavy chromed 4-way wrench fits in my trailer jockey box. It is small but heavy duty and will get the job done. If you are short on storage space, get this wrench, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Pulley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy I purchased this. I just wish I had ordered them sooner, but grateful to own them and no longer need to use the one with my vehicle when I change my seasons tires out.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.text: I could not use any of the four sockets for my daughter's car. I could use it on my car. I borrowed a neighbor's cross bar wrench last week to change a tire on my daughter's car and ordered this one for her car. I thought the sizes were standard.
customer_reviews.author: Charles B.

customer_reviews.title: Universal lug wrench
customer_reviews.text: Well made and exactly what I expected. It's compact and with the ability to use on any vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Carlan

customer_reviews.title: 4 way lug wrench
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should have one of these if you pulling any type of utility trailer. I was always having to gather rachets and sockets when tower my utility trailer but not anymore
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: not the best quality wrench
customer_reviews.text: Wrench has very short arms making it hard to get good leverage while trying to undo a lug nut. The price shows in the quality of product.
customer_reviews.author: ckie

customer_reviews.title: Hug a lug !
customer_reviews.text: Super strong and compact lug wrench with a 17mm lug that helped me take off my ATV wheels. I could not budge these lugs with a 17mm socket wrench and this lug wrench did the trick, easily. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: T. S. Benedetto

customer_reviews.title: Top quality 4-way wrench!
customer_reviews.text: Very strong. No twisting . Socket size is deeply fluted and very close tolerance to nut size. This minimizes the chance for rounding off the sdges of the nut. Very high quality!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Stephen Nagy

customer_reviews.title: Compact Size
customer_reviews.text: I got this lug wrench for my cargo trailer. It was a bit taller than I expected but fits nicely in the trailer. Easy to carry in case of an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Big

customer_reviews.title: WHEN IT'S TIME FOR A CHANGE...
customer_reviews.text: Great way to speed tire changing.. great product, great price.. excellent value
customer_reviews.author: Frank Mucci

customer_reviews.title: Nice Wrench
customer_reviews.text: It's a lug wrench...what more can you say? Place it on the nut and turn! I do like the fact that it has multiple sizings for different sized lug nuts! I do think that I will order a couple of more for my other 2 cars. Sure beats the hell out of that factory issued one in the trunk!
customer_reviews.author: Juggernaut

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected and the weld is a little sloppy but it works well. I used it 2 days after getting it and it performed well. It earned its stars!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Arrived at a perfect timing as I needed to change a tire
customer_reviews.text: Arrived at a perfect timing as I needed to change a tire. Works great! used it right away. Price could be cheaper but I needed it
customer_reviews.author: John Paul Idica

customer_reviews.title: Easy to stow
customer_reviews.text: Easy to stow away in the toolbox, good tool to have when you need to change a flat on the side of the road.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Not as heavy duty as I would have light and somewhat small. Hope it holds up when I need to use it
customer_reviews.text: Not as heavy duty as I would have light and somewhat small. Hope it holds up when I need to use it
customer_reviews.author: C. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my vehicle!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a smaller 4-way that I could store under a seat for that emergency... this really works for me!
customer_reviews.author: rehollandsworthmusic

customer_reviews.title: Deceptively simple, yet elegant.
customer_reviews.text: 2000 s10 Blazer owner. Okay it surprised me with the overall size. I was expecting larger BUT it turns out the small size is perfect! It fits right alongside my jack and tire blocks in the hidden back compartment. The sizes at each end are in a large font and are quickly identifiable. Couldn't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Pyle

customer_reviews.title: sturdy construction
customer_reviews.text: While I haven't had the opportunity to use it (thank goodness), the wrench seems to be of solid construction and I expect to get many years of service out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price and does exactly what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: It does what you expect. It removes lugnuts and puts em back on. My old wheels were really on there so I would say since it held up with me really wrenching hard on it and didn't deform in any way. This a good value for the money and the center weld held up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little lug wrench. Could be a little bit larger. It gives me the push and pull leverage that I need. Very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Shodan

customer_reviews.title: Big enough, but not TOO big
customer_reviews.text: Way easier to use than crow bar that comes with car. Small enough to fit in trunk by spare tire but heavy duty and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Judson Bock Jr

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Way too short with not nearly enough leverage to remove lug nuts. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: W. B. Malkus

customer_reviews.title: Seems good quality
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made. Welded at center, nicely finished. This is a compact lug wrench, smaller than usual. But I needed a small one due to storage area restrictions
customer_reviews.author: John R. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my car needed glad I bought it when I did cuz I had gotten a flat not long after I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Misty Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very useful.
customer_reviews.text: Your best friend when you have an issue with your tire. The 4-way design makes it easier to loosen the nuts off the bolts as L-shaped one might lead to breaking the bolts themselves if the were over tightened previously.
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. If I only had this the other day, it would have saved me $200! lol It loosened air ratchet lug nets with a simple turn. I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: ECJ

customer_reviews.title: Small = less leverage
customer_reviews.text: Did not have to use it, I keep it in the travel trailer. It seems well made, no way to tell until I need it. It is small so not alot leverage compared to bigger versions. But I wanted a compact non folding one.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a normal sized car
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a normal sized car. Have used it a few times to check spare tire sizes and it feels strong. Would recommend the larger size if you have a large pickup or something with more beefy lug nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Speidel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: perfect item for the trailer, no worrying about the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: brendan14356

customer_reviews.title: fits perfect
customer_reviews.text: needed for the safety lugg nut. did exactly as ordered for. thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4 Way Lug Wrench
customer_reviews.text: Good price, seems to be well made and fits on the lug nuts well. Very compact so you can't get a lot of leverage.
customer_reviews.author: Kenn

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Good price on this would’ve paid more in local store. Well made
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Campbell

customer_reviews.title: It is what you thought it was
customer_reviews.text: Don't need much in a lug wrench. This quality piece came at a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D Markowski

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Quick
customer_reviews.text: Spins on or off the lug nuts from the wheels of any vehicle I drive.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Bee

customer_reviews.title: I got it today. My family has welders in it. Nobody thinks it’s a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: It’s what it’s supposed to be Sometimes they make mistakes but this is really simple and if it does somehow break. I’m sure you can get another one. If it’s a reasonable amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Rigoberto Rivas

customer_reviews.title: Nice lug wrench
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and easy to use. Small enough to easily store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller then I thought It'd be.
customer_reviews.text: On the small side but perfect to have for emergency.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid lug wrench. For a smaller person like myself it is an excellent way to get more leverage than on the single lug wrench that came with my car.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Jasso

customer_reviews.title: Economical and Compact
customer_reviews.text: I haven't even used it yet, but it's economical, it's compact, and it fits nicely in my trunk which is why I wanted it so giving it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Larson

customer_reviews.title: ... use this wrench and found it to be as good as any lug wrench that I have used in ...
customer_reviews.text: I have finally had the opportunity to use this wrench and found it to be as good as any lug wrench that I have used in the past. Also had no issues with this supplier.
customer_reviews.author: J&B

customer_reviews.title: This is good
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice solid tool as you would expect
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Too small size and low quality
customer_reviews.text: Too small, unable to exert force. I could only hit it with a hammer and it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Song

customer_reviews.title: Small, sturdy, perdect
customer_reviews.text: Great price and great size for cars truck. Beats the junky tire tool that comes in cars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lug Wrench
customer_reviews.text: Use regularly to check lug tightening on my trailers, works great
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Is very flimsy, and does feel like it is cheaply made. Will work for now, but don’t have much confidence in how long it will last
customer_reviews.author: KRW

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this for light duty and as a backup for my larger cross wrenches. The value is good, I just don't know where they were made and I haven't had an occasion to test this product.
customer_reviews.author: marcos baca

customer_reviews.title: This is a great wrench
customer_reviews.text: Was worried might not be strong enough but I was quite surprised. Had some tough lug nuts which broke my OEM wrench. I was able to get my lug nuts loose even using a cheater bar with the new wrench. Very good construction and well worth price paid. I will have this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but ok
customer_reviews.text: Not very heavy duty. The weld between the arms is not very secure
customer_reviews.author: dischmond

customer_reviews.title: Two pieces riveted together, not one piece forged.
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I expected and there are two separate bars held together by two plates riveted together. I am used to one piece units with more length for torque, I'm not optimistic about this lasting very long.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Very nice wrench
customer_reviews.text: I have a trailer that I wanted this 4way wrench to keep in the tool box. I have used it and it is very sturdy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Hank D

customer_reviews.title: Very well made! Great price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 for everyone in the family! Very well made, keep in my car just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Knox

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: The universal lug wrench was exactly what I was looking for. Have used and seems to be made of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Buyer

customer_reviews.title: not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: no leverage useless. Also not as it appears in picture. There is an intrusive brace at the joint; can't spin off lug nuts well.
customer_reviews.author: Texan99109

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a winner...pending next shi! storm of events!
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it yet...some day I will find out and update. But looks AOK!
customer_reviews.author: TAWEBER

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly. Works great. Wish it was a little bigger to get that extra bit of torque.
customer_reviews.author: Deriley82

customer_reviews.title: Socket to me!
customer_reviews.text: Well it's a wrench, it wrenches things. Well done EPAuto, well done.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: How quick you get everything done with barely any strength
customer_reviews.text: this is one of the best tools to have, you barely have to use any strength because of the 14".
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but a bit small.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and strong but a bit shorter arms than I would like. I would give it 5 stars if it were bigger - more torque.
customer_reviews.author: PAS182

customer_reviews.title: Emergency Savior
customer_reviews.text: Good for 22" - 24" Rims you can even put the Lug Lock Key in the insert and unlock Rim Lug. Great for storage in trunk or under seat.
customer_reviews.author: ADRIAN MCLEOD

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: simple functional and works well on both metric and standard lugs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Blair

customer_reviews.title: Smaller then expected
customer_reviews.text: It might be heavy duty but wayyyyy smaller than anticipated. Can barely crank on it, you will need an extension.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Reyes Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Product received and fits the lug nuts on my 2011 ...
customer_reviews.text: Product received and fits the lug nuts on my 2011 Nissan Rogue. I haven't tested the durability of the product yet but I would think it can handle what it is designed to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Compact size & sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry behind the seat. I keep it in both trucks to ensure I have whats needed when towing.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey K

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like this wrench because it is smaller and lighter than most. Easier to handle!!

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I need it to do for changing wheels on race days
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I need it to do for changing wheels on race days. Nothing really to note.

customer_reviews.title: only good in emergency last minute
customer_reviews.text: the bar is short. only good in emergency last minute. not really ideal since it doesn't really give much leverage.
customer_reviews.author: Tuyen Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Glad I purchased this product. Really needed it for my car. Works as expected. It is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly and easily! A real serendipity and a must for any ...
customer_reviews.text: Within days of receiving this lug wrench, I had the opportunity to use it changing a tire for my daughter on her 2008 Camry. Worked perfectly and easily! A real serendipity and a must for any car trunk!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce K. Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Item works exactly as advertised. I do wish that I had gone with a 16" or larger lug wrench to make it easier to remove the lugnuts/easier to tighten them.
customer_reviews.author: Greg W

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, just what I wanted. My son was happy with it but knew exactly what it was under the tree of course. Should have wrapped it in a box. HaHa

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a little smaller than I was expecting but it worked

customer_reviews.text: BUY A BIGGER ONE. THIS 14 INCH IS PRETTY SMALL

customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use with my popup trailer. One end fits the trailer another the bolts for the spare tire.... Makes changing tires a Lot easier.

product_meta.title: EPAuto 14" Heavy Duty Universal Lug Wrench, 4-Way Cross Wrench
feature_bullets: Durability: Made from Forged heat treated carbon steel
14 inches body length for easy leverage
Four socket heads fit most common SAE and metric lug nut sizes.
